Description.val:
The FY 2016 funding request was reduced by $3.201 million to account for the availability of prior year execution balances.

Funding provides for the procurement of High Efficiency Small-Capacity (HES-C) Air Conditioning Compressors and Brushless Generators for the Power Management Platform (PMP) for the LHD Midlife Program.  HES-C provides additional air conditioning capability to support growing electronic cooling requirements.  The Brushless Generator replacement will reduce down time, total ownership costs, and maintenance costs associated with antiquated brush type generators. Also replace obsolete main feed pump for main propulsion boiler.

ModificationTitle.val: LH001 - LHD Midlife, Brushless Generator for PMP

Title.val: LH001 - LHD Midlife, Brushless Generator for PMP

Name.@footnote: Four (4) Generators are required to complete a shipset; The FY2015 procurement funding includes one shipset (4 generators) and one additional generator (1 generator) to be used for engineering testing (shock and vibration, etc).  The FY2016 procurement funding includes only one shipset (4 generators).  FY2016 installation funds include DSA funds required for Advance Planning, shipcheck, and Ship Installation Drawing (SID) development for the FY17 Installation.

ImplementationMethodName.val: AIT:: Installation Name: Brushless Generator for PMP

Description.val: The Brushless Generator replacement will reduce down time, total ownership costs, and maintenance costs associated with antiquated brush type generators.

Name.@footnote: FY 2016 funds are required for significant Non-Recurring Engineering for Heating, Ventilation, and Air Conditioning (HVAC) improvements, which are required to resolve obsolescence issues in advance of the ship availability start in 2Q20.

Description.val: This ship alteration improves the Heating, Ventilation, and Air Conditioning (HVAC) capability for the LHD's as part of the LHD midlife.

Name.@footnote: FY2016 Non-Recurring Engineering (NRE) funds are required to select the correct impeller size, the proper pump size to drive it, and perform engineering testing prior to the first procurement in FY17.

ImplementationMethodName.val: Industrial:: Installation Name: Main Feed Pump

Description.val: [Main Feed Pump] Replacement of obsolete main feed pump with new shock qualified unit to meet service life.

Name.@footnote: Two (2) of the three (3) units procured in FY16 will be installed during LHD 2 and LHD 3 FY16 avails; remaining unit (1) will be installed on LHD 4 during scheduled first quarter FY 2017 avail.

ImplementationMethodName.val: Inudstrial:: Installation Name: VSD Fire Pumps

Description.val: [VSD Fire Pumps] Replace steam driven fire pumps with variable speed drive (VSD) electric fire pumps to support service life.

ImplementationMethodName.val: [none specified]:: Installation Name: Reverse Osmosis Water Generator

Description.val: [Reverse Osmosis Water Generator] Provides additional water making capability to support crew water requirements and additional corrosion washdown in well deck.
